c74object.name: sadam.phasor~
c74object.digest: Phasor object with maximal resting state
c74object.description:
sadam.phasor~
will generate a ramp between 0 and 1 with the given frequency. The only difference between this object and the legacy
phasor~ object is that if frequency is set to 0, the ramp will continue until it reaches 1. This can be useful in scenarios when the phasor is controlling a modulation and for 0 frequency we'd like to turn off the modulation completely, including DC effects.

objarg.name: initial-frequency (Hz)
objarg.description: Sets the initial frequency of the phasor.

method.name: int
method.description:
In left inlet: Sets the frequency of the phasor.
In right inlet: Sets the initial phase of the phasor (between 0 and 1).

method.name: float
method.description:
In left inlet: Sets the frequency of the phasor.
In right inlet: Sets the initial phase of the phasor (between 0 and 1).

method.name: signal
method.description: In left inlet: Sets the frequency of the phasor.

example.caption: Example of a ring modulator that will always give maximum gain when the modulation is turned off (independent of the current phase of the modulator in the moment it got turned off).

entry.name: signal
entry.description: A signal ramping between 0 and 1 at the given frequency.
